design.title: Personal Blog
design.subtitle: Custom designed blog
design.bodytext: A blog I designed and created for myself as a way to showcase the various projects on which I was working.

design.title: Super DNN World
design.subtitle: DotNetNuke Design Challenge Community Favorite
design.bodytext: I created a custom theme for DotNetNuke around the concept of the Super Mario Brothers games. Every asset in this theme pack was hand drawn and configured to work within DNN. Yes, even the slide show of the complete first level was hand drawn.

features.text: Reusable designs for all module containers

design.title: Staroba Web Development
design.subtitle: Corporate site design
design.bodytext: This site was the face of my company when I was running my own business. It was done mostly in Flash, when that was a thing.

design.title: Personal Website
design.subtitle: Changing with the seasons
design.bodytext: This was a design I created for my personal website. The idea behind the multiple designs is that the theme would change based on the time of year of the visitor.

design.title: Portfolio Website Concept
design.subtitle: Portfolio site beta
design.bodytext: Keeping only the logo from my previous site design, I wanted to go with a more organic look and feel with this design

design.title: St. Paul's Mini Golf Classic
design.subtitle: Flyer designed for a church miniature golf event.
design.bodytext: This was a fun project as I got to use my Wacom tablet and draw all of the graphical pieces. The church has large stained glass windows which I used as inspiration for this design.

design.title: Trick or Treat
design.subtitle: Halloween Party Poster
design.bodytext: We decided to throw a Halloween party at work so I designed this poster as a fun way to get my fellow employees excited.

design.title: Mardi Gras
design.subtitle: 2010 Mardi Gras Poster Competition.
design.bodytext: My submission for the 2010 Mardi Gras parade in St. Louis, Missouri. This parade is considered to be the second largest Mardi Gras celebration in the U.S. The theme was famous kings and queens.

development.title: Customer selector
development.subtitle: Custom searchable drop down menu
development.bodytext: Due to the large number of results, the client needed a way to easily find the correct customer. I created a custom searchable drop down list that allowed for the display of multi-line results. This component is both WCAG AA compliant, responsive, and keyboard accessible

features.text: Custom searchable drop down list with multi-line results

development.title: Billing Summary Portal
development.subtitle: Custom tabbed interface
development.bodytext: Added a custom and reusable tab system to allow for users to easily access information required. This new tab system replaced a cumbersome and difficult to implement tab system aiding developers in the implementation efforts throughout the portal.

development.title: Invoice Table
development.subtitle: Searchable and filterable table
development.bodytext: We created several data tables for the client levering the Headless UI table component from TanStack.

development.title: Form Builder
development.subtitle: Custom form builder redesign
development.bodytext: We redesigned a custom form builder to be WCAG AA compliant with an improved user experience.

features.text: Drag and drop form element creation

development.title: Missouri Botanical Garden
development.subtitle: Mobot site restructure and design
development.bodytext: Consolidated multiple sites and legacy back end systems into a single unified content management system.

features.text: Custom module development to meet clients needs
Performed extensive training with client on leveraging new CMS system.

development.title: Press Release Manager
development.bodytext: Back in 2005, I worked at a small web design firm that wanted to offer their clients a way to manage press releases without requring web site changes. I created this custom press release manager to fulfill this need. It was later turned into a standard feature we offered to all our clients.

features.text: Update press releases without requring HTML knowledge
Custom icons to indicate status of press release

illustration.title: Male Portrait
illustration.subtitle: Practice sketch
illustration.bodytext: I painted this portrait with a Wacom in Photoshop as an exercise to become more comfortable working with a digital medium.

illustration.title: The Governator

illustration.bodytext: I drew Arnold Schwarzenegger and various muscle diagrams for a class project in art school.

illustration.title: Spawn
illustration.subtitle: Drawing of Todd McFarlane's Spawn character
illustration.bodytext: I spent each of my one hour lunch breaks for seventeen days drawing the comic book character spawn.

illustration.title: Unknown Heroine
illustration.subtitle: Concept character
illustration.bodytext: A traditional drawing of a character I created that was colored in Photoshop.

illustration.title: Wolverine vs Lady Deathstrike
illustration.subtitle: Fight to the death
illustration.bodytext: As a fourteen year old, I spent a lot of times drawing and using comic books as my reference. This is a drawing of original artwork by Larry Hama and Marc Silvestri.

photography.title: Faith
photography.subtitle: Digital manipulation
photography.bodytext: This work combines various photos I took combined and altered in photoshop.

photography.title: Veer logo
photography.subtitle: Veer logo design contest
photography.bodytext: Veer was a design services company that challenged people to design their logo using traditional medium.

photography.title: Park Door
photography.subtitle: Door on a building at a local park.
photography.bodytext: I really enjoyed the textures and composition this door created.

photography.title: Modern Twist
photography.subtitle: Modern lamp in historic district
photography.bodytext: While exploring a very historic neighborhood, I found these modern lamps that were made to match the age of the buildings.
